newsitem.title: CHINA: China telephone capacity hits 100 mln by end-1996.
newsitem.headline: China telephone capacity hits 100 mln by end-1996.

text.p: China's telephone capacity is expected to exceed 100 million by the end of this year from 80 million at the end of 1995, Zhang Chunjiang, spokesman for the Ministry of Posts and Telecommunications, said on Tuesday.
The telephone penetration rate at the end of 1996 would reach 6.2 percent, compared with 4.66 percent a year earlier, the Xinhua news agency quoted Zhang as saying.
In 1996, China achieved a 34.5 percent increase in business volume for posts and telecommunications services, he said.
The telephone penetration rate in urban areas, jumped to 22 percent this year from 17 percent in 1995, Zhang said.
In 1996, China invested 98 billion yuan in posts and telecommunications projects, including long-distance optical fibre networks. A total of 31 ground satellite stations have been built or upgraded.
China aims to expand its telephone capacity to reach 170 million by the turn of the century, up by 20 million each year, Xinhua said.
